page.title: 07THE ELDERLY IN ROMSEY
page.content: We found that some elderly people who live in Romsey are very nervous of the younger generation. Two elderly people did not answer the door, two opened the door, and seeing that we were children, closed it again, and one lady looked through her letterbox before opening the door. One man's definition of Romsey was 'a nice town with a good variety of shops, but which are far too expensive'. Most of the elderly people thought that Romsey would retain its character in the future, but would grow much larger. When we asked where they shopped, most said Carrefour, some in Waitrose and a few in Sainsburys. Their main transport is cars and buses. When we asked what they thought of all the new estates being built in Romsey they simply replied, 'You just have to live with it'.
